title.narrative: COST EFFECTIVE SP FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Different models for more efficient and cost- effective design and implementation of social protection policy for children (cash transfers and services) developed for consideration by the Government, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Economic And Social Policy General, Public Finance And Local Governance, Reducing Child Poverty, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys, especially those affected by poverty, adversity and exclusion, progressively utilise quality, inclusive and efficient education system reinforced by policies, programmes and services for empowerment and participation, by 2022.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Different models for more efficient and cost- effective design and implementation of social protection policy for children (cashtransfers and services) developed for consideration by the Government

description.narrative: In 2021, Montenegro introduced universal child allowance for all children 0-6. The policy was introduced after UNICEF showcased substantial evidence about relevance of universal social protection policies in Montenegro. The policy was rolled out with UNICEF support and the Country Office continues to support improved design of the policy.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/01/2022
